intro: Gymnotrix mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine layer of pubescence. Gymnotrix mexicana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
